content:
Supernal is at the forefront of creating emerging mobility solutions that will foster the development of human-centered cities. We are designing a completely new electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft tailored to the mobility needs of future cities. This allows passengers a seamless intermodal journey that safely transports them to their final destination. We fuse research in autonomy, robotics, aviation and services to define a new category of mobility for the world’s communities. We believe in creative thinking and collaboration to help build a better mobility experience for everyone, improving people’s ability to move – whether for work or play.
What we do: 
The Sr. Actuation Engineer is responsible for the development of the actuation system for the Supernal eVTOL flight control system. The role is heavily involved in developing efficient electro-mechanical actuation solution for aircraft flight control surfaces from conceptualizing and design to prototyping and manufacturing, and through production support. The role works closely with an outside supplier and internal technical teams including Flight Controls, Electrical & Wiring, Flight Technology, Airframe, and Test & Evaluation.
This position will be required to work on-site 5 days a week.
What you can do:

Participate in Actuation system lifecycle development activities including requirements definition, design reviews, procurement/manufacturing, and qualification/certification
Define and mature the actuation system & actuator LRU requirements (Functional, Performance Safety, Environmental) and mechanical/electrical interfaces
Provide technical guidance and oversight to actuator supplier through development lifecycle
Analyze actuation performance including mechanism kinematics, load/stress, and clearance
Support integrating actuation components 3D models into aircraft digital mockup model
Document system function and performance, including specifications & compliance reports
Support aircraft installation and integration, including writing and releasing engineering orders and functional test procedures required for flight test and production aircraft
Prepare and communicate design and technical material to management and stakeholders
May require up to 10% of domestic and international travel
Other duties as assigned

What you can contribute:

Bachelor’s degree in mechanical or related engineering field required; Master’s or Ph.D. degree preferred
Minimum five (5) years of experience with flight control actuation system/product development (an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered)
Experience with rotorcraft and/or fixed-wing Fly-By-Wire flight control systems/products
Experience with new aircraft development, prototyping, certification, and production
Working knowledge of ASME Y14.5 Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T)
Familiarity with any FAA CFR parts 23/25/27/29 or other certification experience
Proficient using CAD modeling & drawing tools
Proficient using requirements capture and management tools
Knowledge of qualification and certification rules and standards applicable to commercial aircraft systems and equipment, including ARP 4754A, ARP 4761, DO-160
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

You may also be able to contribute:

3D-Experience/Enovia/CATIA preferred
DOORS NG preferred
